Description: Influenza Virus A Antibodies, IgG and IgM (Separate Determinations), Serum
Reporting Description: Influenza Virus A Ab, IgG, IgM, S
Specimen Requirements:
Container/Tube: 
Preferred: Red top
Acceptable: Serum gel
Specimen Volume: 0.25 mL
Additional Information: 
1. Incidence of influenza virus infections is seasonal in the United States and usually occurs only from November to March.
2. Indicate influenza virus A.
Reject Due To:
Hemolysis	Mild OK; Gross reject
Thawing	Warm reject; Cold OK
Lipemia	Mild OK; Gross reject
Icterus	NA
Other	NA
Reference Values:
IgG: <1:10
IgM: <1:10
The presence of IgM class antibodies or a 4-fold or greater rise in paired sera IgG titer indicates recent infection. The presence of demonstrable IgG generally indicates past exposure.
